title: Sip & Puff Mouse
subtitle: Personal project
description: Open source, < $100 Sip-and-Puff mouse for paralyzed patients. Existing options are $1k-$2k. Allows patients to mimic all mouse interactions. 3D printed, designed in Fusion 360. Arduino based with customizable sensitivity and analog filtering. THT soldering, analog sensors. Breath filter and stainless steel mouthpiece. Same functionality and sanitation as commercial options. Instructions and files are freely available online. First Prize in the Instructables.com Microcontroller Contest 2018. Featured on Hackaday, Open-electronics.org, and New Mobility Magazine.
links_text: Article in Spinal Cord Injury Zone

title: Intro to Game Development Workshops
subtitle: UBC Design League club
description: As head of the game dev program for the UBC Design League club, I teach public workshops on game development. Topics include: game design, programming, art, and level design.

title: Twenty Flappy Eight
subtitle: Personal project
description: Combines the frantic arcade gameplay of Flappy Bird with the strategic number matching of 2048.

title: Photogrammetry Accuracy Investigation
subtitle: Craig Hospital
description: Meshes generated from photos. Comparable in detail and resolution to an expensive structured light scanner. OpenCV and Python to capture images from a multi-camera array. Open source AliceVision Python pipeline to generate mesh. Compared generated meshes with scans from a structured light scanner. Photogrammetry meshes had .19 mm of average mesh error. System cost 85% less than a structured light scanner.

title: Personal Website
subtitle: Personal project
description: Built this website from scratch using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Hosted on GitHub Pages.

title: Economic Schools of Thought
subtitle: Final project for AP Macroeconomics
description: Fast paced arcade game built in Scratch that teaches the player about different schools of economic thought.

title: Text Adventure Template
subtitle: Personal project
description: Simple, node based text adventure template built in Unity. Template includes demo game. Supports save files, inventory, choices, and audio

title: Civil War Spy
subtitle: Final project for middle school history class
description: Historical stealth game built in Scratch that teaches the player about espionage in the American Civil War.

title: Turkey Hunt
subtitle: Final project for middle school technology class
description: Side-scrolling hunting game built in Scratch. Enviroment uses (low resolution) panoramic photos of my backyard.

title: Figure 8
subtitle: Personal project
description: Fast-paced arcade game, avoid crashing into the orbiting balls. Built in Scratch. Includes a global high score system for signed in users.

title: Wiring Harness
subtitle: UBC Formula SAE design team
description: Designed and built wiring harness for racecar's 15+ modules, sensors, and PCBs. Designed harness in RapidHarness. Built harness with crimping tools, concentric twisting, and heat shrink. Installed harness on vehicle.

title: CAN Steering Position Sensor
subtitle: UBC Formula SAE design team
description: Integrated 0.5 Mb/s OEM CAN bus steering position sensor into existing 1 Mb/s network. Custom STM32 firmware translates between CAN speeds. Validated solution with oscilloscope. Implemented solution on vehicle. Successful integration of 2 different CAN network speeds. Steering position data collected for suspension and aerodynamic validation.

title: Hovercraft Design Project
subtitle: UBC Mechanical Engineering
description: Designed, created, and raced a hovercraft in a Hackathon-style two week mechanical engineering team competition. Implemented RC control of 2 brushed DC motors with Arduino and off-the-shelf receiver & ESC. Designed battery-powered lift and propulsion system. Custom motor control system won 1st place (20 teams) in acceleration competition. Battery system won 3rd place (20 teams) in endurance race.

title: Kill Switch PCB
subtitle: UBC Formula SAE design team
description: Kill switch logic on the UBC Formula student team racecar. Safety-critical PCB. Meets strict SAE competition and industry standards. Designed in Altium. SMD and THT soldering. Waterproof conformal coating, heat shrink, EVA strain relief, and custom enclosure. Eliminated vibration disconnection issue with previous implementation. LEDs communicate kill switch and battery status. Presented justification for SAE competition.

title: Manufacturing Experience
subtitle: UBC Mechanical Engineering & UBC Formula SAE design team
description: Machined parts according to engineering drawings. Manufactured within tolerance. Improved my machining skills.

title: Conformal Cuff Procedure
subtitle: Craig Hospital
description: Created a procedure to digitize hand shapes of patients. Integrated a design pipeline with scanned mesh models. Manufactured custom typing and feeding cuffs. Protected patient data in secure database. Delivered a fully documented process to engineers & therapists. Eliminated skin abrasions, improved fit and function, and reduced cost by 60% compared to previous solution.
